website_summaries.verdict: The Brooks Adrenaline GTS 19, similar to another Brooks stability shoe, the Transcend 6, was able to capture its target audience, runners who needed support to combat overpronation. People felt that it was comfortable, secure and non-irritating as it wrapped the foot. The quality of the components was also praised. Meanwhile, a consistent complaint among users is the poor construction of the shoe, which has resulted to a lack of durability.
pros: Many people claimed that the in-shoe experience was comfortable right out of the box
The façade didn’t have a bulky look, and a lot of testers liked that aspect
The upper unit gained favor for being breathable and flexible
Some runners felt that the pronation support given by the Brooks Adrenaline GTS 19’s midsole was more substantial than the ones in the previous iterations
The general quality of the components wasn’t overshadowed by the price, some runners noted
they felt that this shoe had an affordable starting price
Purchasers liked the fact that, for a stability shoe, the Adrenaline GTS 19 didn’t have a heavy build
The upper offered smooth and non-irritating coverage, many runners stated
cons: The durability of the Brooks Adrenaline GTS 19 was criticized by several reviewers as they experienced the sole coming apart or the stitches unraveling

customer_reviews.title: Knee problems banished.
customer_reviews.text: Was recommended these as I have knee problems and a slipped disc inmy back. I walk a bit with work and alsways end the day with extremely sore knees. Wearing these shoes instsntly stopped this and I am now in no pain whilst walking at all. They really are wonderful. Showed them to my osteopath, a man who always knows more than I do about everything. Was amazed when he told me they are the only show he recommends. So that's rare praise indeed. I ordered half a size larger than my normal shoe and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: leaflysock

customer_reviews.title: Good for doing the miles
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Brooks Beasts but have found the last few pairs too heavy and not great quality. I have also purchased Brooks GTS previously and found them to be light weight but became worn down quite quickly (I run half marathons regularly and clocked up 1200 miles last year). These ones do not feel as light weight, more stable and better around the toes. So far I have enjoyed training in them.
customer_reviews.author: Vinibash

customer_reviews.title: Not as solid as expected but still good
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, size-wise I am a shoe size UK 10/44 EUR, and for these I went for a 44.5 due to the varying feedback. Turns out I was spot on lengthwise for me. However I do find the shoes a little wider than preferred (I have moderately narrow feet) and thus these don't quite feel as solid and supportive as I was looking for. That said they were comfortable enough on first outing (slow 5 miles) with no adverse effects. Generally I can't help but feel that all running shoes regardless of maker seem less robust and long-lasting than they used to be, as the 'minimalist' fashion has taken over - or is that just a sign of me getting old?
customer_reviews.author: D, London

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I have bad pain in my feet on walking and this has got worse over several years despite differing treatments. I have tried numerous pairs of shoes and tried these after seeing reviews of how comfortable they are. I was delighted by my first pair over 6 months ago and they have transformed my ability to walk more than small distances. The pain is much reduced and I am walking 5 or more miles a day. I was so pleased that I have bought 2 more pairs! I cannot recommend these highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Probably my 12'th pair of these shoes
customer_reviews.text: If anybody wants to open a museum around the progression of the Brooks Adrenaline Running shoe from version 6 to present date, please let me know as I probably still have used versions of every shoe. This has been my 'go to' running shoe for over 10 years. I've been unfaithful a couple of times, but always gone back to them and have ran everything up to Marathons in them.
customer_reviews.author: Old Running Dude

customer_reviews.title: Best for stability, cushioning and comfort
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with these. Wore them for the first time last week running in a 5k race, and I got a PB time. Don't order a size up as another reviewer recommended. They are true to size. I had to return a pair because I listened to that review, they were too big. Overall I highly recommend the GTS 19, a big step up in comfort from my asics and also 40 euros cheaper on Amazon than any sports shop near me. Short Update: Just did a 10k race in these shoes and they were perfect and come into their own over longer distances. I'm going to get another pair just to have them. A+
customer_reviews.author: G.G.

customer_reviews.title: They even come  laced and ready to wear out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Great support around the ankle and really soft underfoot. Read some reviews saying to go a size up from usual shoe size but i ignored this and bought my normal shoe size which is an 8. Usually EU size for an 8 is 42 but these were 42.5. So I suppose I’ve gone up half a size really. Anyway they are a great fit with room for foot expansion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent support trainer!
customer_reviews.text: A brilliant new update on the Adrenaline series. The guide rails system offers great support while the dna loft in the sole gives the shoe great cushioning. They’re very comfortable and light and I love the new look of the 19s. Will be using these for plenty of long runs and races over the next year!
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: I expected these to make me run faster
customer_reviews.text: I did a few hundreds metres in these and then remembered something. I remembered Im too fat to run so headed off on a walk instead. These are the most comfortable shoes I have worn for walking. I go them as my knees and shins were starting to hurt and on day one of these I can feel the stress on my legs less. The fit is amazing, the first running shoes that fit my fat fit but not overwide Think I have found a brand of shoes I will be sticking with
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and support for bigger 'athlete'
customer_reviews.text: Bought as replacement long run shoe. I have flat feet and found them comfortable and supportive. Completed 1st marathon in them. Weight training has kept my weight at approx 98kg so shoes tend to wear out and lose support fast. Will update on how well they did when they finally wear out.
customer_reviews.author: P J Hewerdine

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped 19s?No.
customer_reviews.text: There is too much hype about running shoes. I’m 6 feet tall and weigh 16 stone 8lbs and get knee ache on runs over 2-3k. So, despite being a long time Brooks user, I was sceptical about the claims that the guide bars/tracks in the 19s offered any knee protection. Did 11k in my Brooks 18 last week, for example, and suffered knee pain near the end and afterwards. Two days ago I used these newly purchased shoes for a 12k run. My longest run for 10 years. On the day of the 12k, and two days later, not a twinge. Very impressed and delighted customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm on over-pronator and found these shoes work for me.... Always get a decent opinion (gait analysis or 'expert opinion') before buying any running shoe though if you're new to running. After an 6 year hiatus from running, these have served me well so far. I've got two pairs now (one for treadmill and one for outside use).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Packman

customer_reviews.title: Super support. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Adrenaline GTS 6s to the 19s - brilliant decision. I would have gone down the Asics Gel Kayano route but I'm glad I didn't. Was suffering from knee pain with the old shoes and this has totally disappeared. Shoes are a perfect fit and really comfortable to run in. I should have made the switch years ago. The GTS 19s offer great support for the overpronating runner. Only downside is they're not waterproof but they dry very quickly. Don't delay, buy today!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Richard McCreery

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these because I love to run but have flat feet. Perfectly supports my arches - stops foot ache, ankle and knee problems. Well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Ragdoll Radio

customer_reviews.title: Wide fitting running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a wide fitting running shoes and I've finally found one. It has just arrived and I put it on straight away like a child receiving his birthday present and it fitted superbly and feels so light on the feet as if walking on air
customer_reviews.author: A. I. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for over pronators
customer_reviews.text: Really great for correcting partners over pronation. We do more bootcamp, functional fitness rather than running and these are good for that. Tried a similar style from a competitor which we had to return before buying these as the heel was too wide and caused slipping. These have a better fit for narrow heels.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Furlongs

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant - highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, these shoes are amazing! I've ran three marathons, the last one in berlin wearing Asics Nimbus 21, which are great too but these felt so light and comfortable, i honestly felt like i was flying from the first run. Really happy, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit. Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Been meaning to replace my worn out running shoes. Decided to stay with Brooks and went for these. As recommended, I took a size larger than my everyday shoes. Result? A perfect fit. Really comfortable to run in.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Knee pain gone
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. Purchased a pair of transcends at the same time, wish I’d just got two pairs of these. Used to get knee pain when I hit the 4-5km mark (thanks army), don’t get it at all with these. Did a 10 miler the other day, no problems. Not the fastest or lightest shoe ever, but definitely a good purchase for over pronation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would run 500 miles.
customer_reviews.text: As a keen distance runner, I know how important getting correctly fitting trainers is. After a gait analysis a few years ago, I was recommended these trainers and have never looked back. each year they bring out new designs and I would never buy any other trainers. stylish, comfortable and good value.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Birthday present
customer_reviews.text: Normally spend 30 pounds on trainer and the only last 4 5 months. Got these as a birthday present. amazing comfort really nice running shoes will get brooks trainers again
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and improving pronation as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material, comfortable and great for running. On top of this if you have pronation (i think it is overpronation) it really helps. I have them for a month now, I will see how long they last but the seem well built
customer_reviews.author: Vlad M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Brooks, I've recently been getting leg pain when I go for a walk, so thought I'd invest in a decent pair of trainers, they fit perfectly and have had hardly any pain since, very happy
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Wide feet neutral runner
customer_reviews.text: So far pretty good. Bought these to replace my Brooks Ghost shoes. Pretty good like for like. I have wide feet and am a neutral runner. So far, 100 miles in, I’ve not experienced any issues with them. My average run is 5 miles and my longest run has been 1hr 20m so I’d say they suit my wide feet and neutral running position.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D James

customer_reviews.title: Inspired by the great reviews
customer_reviews.text: Usually buy asics ... but read lots of great reviews so thought I would choose these for my husband ... he’s thrilled with them.
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: Happy run
customer_reviews.text: Great comfy running shoes . Cushion much softer and my heel pains seem better already . ( known plantar fasciitis) I normally wear size 42 EU and got 42.5 which fits just right . Happy customer
customer_reviews.author: Luka

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & supportive
customer_reviews.text: First Brooks, but tried due to online recommendations for support for heavier runners (ex rugby player!). Size 11 usually needing wider fitting & fitted perfectly from first use. Really comfortable & supportive cushioning & very pleased. 😀
customer_reviews.author: Dyfrig

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and a great fit
customer_reviews.text: I love these trainers. They fit well and are very comfortable - I’ve already run a 20-miler in mine.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Heavy runner (very)
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty new to running, but knew I needed something good - I’m a heavy runner with history of knee niggles. These are awesome - incredibly light compared to what I’m used to and seem to provide both comfort and stability. I’ve done 10 x 5k runs in then so far and can’t fault them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Hotchkin

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: Love them!! So refreshing to run with and regret not getting them sooner
customer_reviews.author: Tim W

customer_reviews.title: great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Had an ankle issue. My Nike shoes were too old to continue running. THey allowed me to start running again and my ankle problem has stopped. I measured my foot on a piece of paper and used that measurement for ordering the shoe and it fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Feel Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Very. Comfy shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shoe for a half marathon in March went straight out and did 10 miles no problems at all very light well cushioned good all round running shoe
customer_reviews.author: MR MARK WHITCHELO

customer_reviews.title: Brooks GTS
customer_reviews.text: The best marathon shoe Go a 1/2 size up from normal
customer_reviews.author: Dispatch

customer_reviews.title: Very prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic service from seller as these arrived less than 24 hours after ordering. My husband was delighted. They are his second pair of Brooks running shoes and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn oshea

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable and Supportive
customer_reviews.text: Previously had the GTS 18 which I really enjoyed. Only changed due to a tear in the 18’s - (turns out they’re not the best shoe to play 5 aside football in!) Really happy with the 19s so far, very comfortable and supportive which is perfect for me. Have low arches and pronate whilst running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Feel and look great - haven’t run in them yet though....it’s been too wet and muddy to dirty them so soon!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I’m an overpronator and these are designed to help with that. It’s my second pair and they are great - straight out of the box and into a 10k run with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: AGC Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing quality - protruding seam injured my Achilles
customer_reviews.text: Seam in heel cushion surround was poorly finished, leaving a sharp element that protruded into my Achilles tendon, and resulted in injury over wearing for a couple of weeks. Brooks have replaced, but the injury has put me out of action for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Tris Lumley

customer_reviews.title: Combination of perfect cushioning and  responsiveness during the  ride.
customer_reviews.text: Great cushioning and responsive feel. Not mushy. Plush comfort feel upper and inside, Roomy toebox. You can push the pace in these even though they are a support shoe. Great for long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Cathal Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Fit the same every time.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, this is my 8th pair of Brooks adrenaline running shoes. They are always comfortable and fit the same as the pair before. Good shoe, and I usually get about 600 miles out of each pair.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect running shoe. This show is ideal for those that are flat footed. Great arch support. Half the price of Nike. Will definitely buy again when I get through these ones. 600km into these and still going strong. 👍🏃‍♂️👟
customer_reviews.author: NJT

customer_reviews.title: For me a harder ride
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoes but I find them a bit hard on the fore foot not much spring
customer_reviews.author: richard tongue

customer_reviews.title: Big toe pain no more in these bad boys 👏
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got arthritis in big toe from years of abuse lol, recommended these specifically because of a rolling type sole, first time ran without any pain or irritation in a long time 👍👍👍👍👏
customer_reviews.author: Peter ford

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with these shoes. Feel great while wearing them for either walking, running or daily routine.
customer_reviews.author: David Barry

customer_reviews.title: My dog loved them - I briefly enjoyed them
customer_reviews.text: Awesome trainers. Great support. Only had 2 x 10k runs in them and my dog has chewed them to bits!
customer_reviews.author: John RK

customer_reviews.title: Great for jogging
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight breathable running shoes with plenty of support. I would recommend but buy a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Support for Pronation
customer_reviews.text: Second part of these excellent support trainers for pronation. Last pair were good for 500 miles. Extremely comfortable over long distances.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Great support and great comfort trainers
customer_reviews.text: These trainers are great! Excellent support for my ankles and really comfy too. No noticeable “wearing-in period” so was good from the moment I received them.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: By far the best running shoe I have bought for over-pronation and painful knees. lets me run and walk at least double the distance pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Like running on air, was quite dubious as these are the first time I have bought online big thumbs-up! And they fit me like a glove on a chickens head.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Evans

customer_reviews.title: Distance running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Suffer from fallen arches. V good support when running. Not so much when walking believe it or not. Solid shoe for long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Bazz

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Pair and they are as great as ever - helping me run 70kms a week :)
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable trainers, for the first time ever
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of trainers. No heel pain since I started wearing these for my treadmill walking/jogging.
customer_reviews.author: Dwazza

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The sneakers arrived as expected. The delivery was fast (less than a week) and it arrived in perfect conditions.
customer_reviews.author: José Costa

customer_reviews.title: A great runner
customer_reviews.text: Always use brooks to train and run marathons never any issue with them
customer_reviews.author: paul sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes, I have one dodgy knee and the cushioning in these shoes really help.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Shearwood

customer_reviews.title: Very good service
customer_reviews.text: Nice quick delivery and good trainers very pleased with service
customer_reviews.author: Gords

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: A supportive light weight shoe. Well cushioned and roomy. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably better than GTS 17
customer_reviews.text: I've run in them only once so far, but my first impressions are very positive. Same fit; better cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: SOM

customer_reviews.title: Distance runner
customer_reviews.text: Great running shoe. Much lighter than the old version. Nice in all black
customer_reviews.author: gerry c

customer_reviews.title: Brooks runners
customer_reviews.text: Great runner, would go up half size if I order again.
customer_reviews.author: ampps

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Adrenaline Gts 19 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Soft cushioning meets industry-leading support. GuideRails holistic support system: Brooks went over the foot, focusing on the body part of a runner most prone to injury: the knees. Guide Rails allows you to move in comfort, keeping the excess movements under control. Soft and balanced cushioning. The BioMoGo DNA and LOFT DNA buffers work in synergy to create the right softness to the sole of the foot without losing reactivity and longevity. Modern fit. The 3D Fit Print mesh and upper give a tapered look to the structure and fit of this unmissable shoe.Shaft height : 32 cm
feature_bullets: SHOE SIZE: "B" = Medium width, "D" = Wide width, "2A" = Narrow width, "2E" = Extra wide width

FOOT SUPPORT: Ideal for runners with all arches looking for support. Our new Guiderail Support System focuses beyond the feet to the most injury-prone part of a runner's body: the knees. GuideRails keep you moving comfortably by keeping excess movement in check.
CUSHIONED FEEL: Soft and protective, these shoes provide just the right amount of cushion in each step to let you float through your run, walk and everyday life.
BALANCED, SOFT CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA and DNA LOFT cushioning work together to provide a just-right softness underfoot without losing responsiveness and durability-yet it feels lighter than ever.
MODERNIZED FIT: Engineered mesh and the 3D Fit Print upper provide the structure and proven fit of this Go-To Shoe with a streamlined look.
